item.description:
Let's Meetup at Atwood's Tavern to listen to and enjoy a true Cambridge treasure, Tim Gearan.  Tim is a terrific singer/songwriter who plays every damned Friday night at Atwood's.

Tim's songs cover a lot of ground -- rock, americana, folk and blues -- with gritty, funny, soulful, hard driving originals mixed in with eclectic covers.  (The Coasters' "Youngblood", anyone?)

Tim's also a terrific guitar player and his band is extraordinary.  The typical lineup:  Lou Ulrich on bass, Sean Staples on "rock'n'roll mandolin", Andy Plaisted on drums, Scott Aruda on trumpet, Paul Ahlstrand on sax (tenor and bari), and Russell Chudnovsky on slide guitar.

The cover is $7 cash at the door, but trust me:  it's the best $7 you'll spend all week.

Housekeeping:

  • Want to hear Tim's music?

    Go to his Facebook page, Listen to Tim Gearan, and click on the 'Music' link.

  • Atwood's is on the small side, so I'm limiting attendance for this Meetup.

  • As mentioned above, there's a $7 cover charge.

    You must pay the cover even if you arrive early -- e.g., for dinner.  The doormen will hunt you down and wrestle you for the money....

  • The music starts 10:30ish; I'll be there at 9pm.

    Musicians must keep time when playing ... but they're not always Real Good about starting on time, so consider 10:30 a broad hint.  But please come early to meet your fellow music lovers.  Also, Atwood's does occasionally sell out, so coming early gets you in the door.

  • I'll send my cell # to all Yes RSVPs early in the evening before the show.

    When I send the email with my cell #, I'll also include notes about parking (always a challenge in Cambridge).

See you at Atwood's!
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be hanging at the end of the bar farthest from the door. I'll also send my cell # to Yes RSVPers early on the evening of the show.
item.name: Tim Gearan @ Atwood's Tavern
